greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-q^3)^4 / (phi(-q) * phi(-q^9)) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q^2) * eta(q^3)^8 * eta(q^18) / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^6)^4 * eta(q^9)^2) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^3]^4 / (EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q^9]), {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^3 + A)^8 * eta(x^18 + A) / (eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^6 + A)^4 * eta(x^9 + A)^2), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 03 2015
